subject: Sales
title: The Rise of the Cold Call
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Rise of the Cold Call.

hook.text: In the 1960s, a rep picked up a phone and dialed a total stranger. The cold call was born â€” and hated.

buildup.text: Cold calling scaled outreach enormously. A single rep could contact hundreds of prospects per day.

discovery.text: Scripts, objection rebuttals, and call tracking turned cold calling into a repeatable science.

twist.text: By the 2000s, results collapsed. Caller ID and voicemail made cold prospects effectively invisible.

climax.text: Cold calling evolved into warm outreach: social selling, referrals, and personalized email sequences.

punchline.text: The cold call evolved. The warm approach won.

quiz.question: What caused cold calling's decline?
options: Caller ID and voicemail made prospects unreachable
